alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 6:36AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Along the Coast Today... From Point Hope south to the Yukon Delta water levels have peaked out 4 ft above normal at most measuring sites. Water levels should remain steady today before falling tonight. This has caused water to rise up through cracks in the sea ice and pushed water on top of the ice in some areas. Some coastal trails on the ice or near the shore could become inundated with water. Communities along the Norton Sound coast from Golovin to Unalakleet, and along the Chukchi Sea Coast from Deering to Kivalina, will see the most significant impacts to the sea ice. Residents living along the coast are encouraged to monitor current conditions before venturing out on the sea ice.
